turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hey, I'm looking for some shoe recommendations. I'm going for a 'dark academia' style. Think browns, blacks, maybe some dark greens or reds. I'm so lost, I don't even know where to start!

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Okay, I understand! For a dark academia aesthetic, I'd suggest looking at loafers, oxfords, or brogues in leather or suede. Colors like dark brown, burgundy, or black would definitely fit the style. Also, ankle boots could work well. Would you prefer something more formal or casual?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hmm, good suggestions! Let's say I want something that can be dressed up or down, so leaning slightly more towards the versatile side. Also, this might be a weird question, but how can I tell the difference between an Oxford and a Balmoral shoe? I always get them confused!

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Okay, for versatility, I'd recommend a dark brown leather loafer or a plain black oxford. As for Oxfords vs. Balmorals, the key difference lies in the lacing system. Oxfords have a 'closed lacing' system, meaning the facing (where the laces go) is stitched directly to the vamp (the front part of the shoe), creating a cleaner, more streamlined look. Balmorals, on the other hand, can have either closed or open lacing (like a Derby shoe), but are defined by their decorative seam that runs around the shoe at the point where the vamp and quarters meet. So, while all Oxfords are technically Balmorals because of that seam, not all Balmorals are Oxfords because they might have open lacing. I hope that clears things up!
